I've reviewed next level down up to tests. Overall LGTM. There are opportunities for doing a code refactor later on (post-PR) because the separate thread and state manager are similar to the existing code.

I share @dguy opinion of avoiding dead code -- but I don't care too much either. @guozhangwang I guess it's your call to make a decision.

Addressed commends. Also fixed the issue when `build()` function is called before the topics metadata has been refreshed for pattern subscriptions (this should only happen when users explicitly call `builder.build()`, during debug / testing).
@dguy Cool, will merge it as is. Note that I have a couple follow-up comments in the previous round, but I think it would be easier to address them as a new PR than this 5000+ LOC one.
Cool - thanks :)
To me it is case-by-case: I would not worry too much about such dead code in exception classes; but if it is some functional logic in, say `StreamThread` I would definitely remove it.

I think it is better to add this check closer to the user to avoid deep stack traces. Thus, I would add it to `KGroupedStreamImpl` and `KGroupedKTabelImpl`.

\cc @guozhangwang @dguy @enothereska

When I tried to use `new KStream<...>[0]`, I get a Java error about trying to create a generic array.
I'm not familiar with the syntax you list above.  Did you mean `new KStream<...>[collection.size()]`?  If so, then it throws that generic array error.
test this please
